item.title: Jordan add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "Seems like the cold would never go away and winter would be like the bottom of my feet but then it is gone in one night and in its place comes the sun so large and laughable." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Being a writer of fiction isn't like being a compulsive liar, honestly." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "I kept always two books in my pocket, one to read, one to write in." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "What I say is, a town isn't a town without a bookstore. It may call itself a town, but unless it's got a bookstore it knows it's not fooling a soul." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Most people don't realize how important librarians are. I ran across a book recently which suggested that the peace and prosperity of a culture was solely related to how many librarians it contained. Possibly a slight overstatement. But a culture that doesn't value its librarians doesn't value ideas and without ideas, well, where are we?" -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Being a writer is a very peculiar sort of a job: it's always you versus a blank sheet of paper (or a blank screen) and quite often the blank piece of paper wins." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "Summer coming like a car from down the highway." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Tomorrow may be hell, but today was a good writing day, and on the good writing days nothing else matters." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "We are all travelers in the wilderness of this world, and the best we can find in our travels is an honest friend." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "Many's the long night I've dreamed of cheese--toasted mostly." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "All speech, written or spoken, is a dead language, until it finds a willing and prepared hearer. " -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "Quiet minds cannot be perplexed or frightened but go on in fortune or misfortune at their own private pace, like a clock during a thunderstorm. " -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "It is not so much for its beauty that the forest makes a claim upon men's hearts, as for that subtle something, that quality of air that emanation from old trees, that so wonderfully changes and renews a weary spirit." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "Our business in life is not to succeed, but to continue to fail in good spirits." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "It is perhaps a more fortunate destiny to have a taste for collecting shells than to be born a millionaire." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "The world is so full of a number of things, I â€™m sure we should all be as happy as kings." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "For I think we may look upon our little private war with death somewhat in this light. If a man knows he will sooner or later be robbed upon a journey, he will have a bottle of the best in every inn, and look upon all his extravagances as so much gained upon thieves....So every bit of brisk living, and above all when it is healthful, is just so much gained upon the wholesale filcher, death. We shall have the less in our pockets, the more in our stomachs, when he cries stand and deliver. --An Inland Voyage" -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Robert Louis Stevenson
item.description: "So long as we love we serve; so long as we are loved by others, I would almost say that we are indispensable; and no man is useless while he has a friend." -- Robert Louis Stevenson

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "Learning does not make one learned: there are those who have knowledge and those who have understanding. The first requires memory and the second philosophy" -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "Never fear quarrels, but seek hazardous adventures." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "There is neither happiness nor misery in the world; there is only the comparison of one state with another, nothing more. He who has felt the deepest grief is best able to experience supreme happiness. We must have felt what it is to die, Morrel, that we may appreciate the enjoyments of life. " Live, then, and be happy, beloved children of my heart, and never forget, that until the day God will deign to reveal the future to man, all human wisdom is contained in these two words, 'Wait and Hope." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "Mastery of language affords one remarkable opportunities." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "True, I have raped history, but it has produced some beautiful offspring." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "You scholars, you're in communication with the devil." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Jordan add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "I have great faith in fools - self-confidence my friends will call it." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "It is a fool's prerogative to utter truths that no one else will speak." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Charlie Chaplin
item.description: "Failure is unimportant. It takes courage to make a fool of yourself" -- Charlie Chaplin

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Shauna Niequist
item.description: "I want a life that sizzles and pops and makes me laugh out loud. And I don't want to get to the end, or to tomorrow, even, and realize that my life is a collection of meetings and pop cans and errands and receipts and dirty dishes. I want to eat cold tangerines and sing out loud in the car with the windows open and wear pink shoes and stay up all night laughing and paint my walls the exact color of the sky right now. I want to sleep hard on clean white sheets and throw parties and eat ripe tomatoes and read books so good they make me jump up and down, and I want my everyday to make God belly laugh, glad that he gave life to someone who loves the gift." -- Shauna Niequist

item.title: Jordan add a quote by Ida Cook
